Key Match Events: Mohamed Salah was injured and left the game at the 45th minute.
Kudus scored the first goal for Ghana after Salah's injury.
Omar Marmoush scored a 69th minute equalizer for Egypt.
Kudus restored Ghana's lead two minutes later with a powerful shot.
Mostafa Mohamed scored an equalizer for Egypt.
Pre-Game Insights: The match was highly anticipated as both teams were expected to top their group.
Both teams needed to avoid defeat to keep their qualification hopes alive.
Post-Match Reflections: Ghana is now on a run of six AFCON games without a win.
Both Egypt and Ghana need to win their final group games to qualify for the round of 16.
